description: Structured work queue for build sessions. Items consumed top-down. R sessions populate via directive intake and direct promotion. Status lifecycle: pending → in-progress → done | blocked | retired. Blocked items may have a blocker_check (shell command) — heartbeat.sh runs it before B sessions and auto-promotes to pending on exit 0. Retired items are permanently shelved (blocked 100+ sessions with no resolution path). Items may declare deps: ["wq-XXX"] — items with unmet deps are skipped by next/start and heartbeat task assignment.

queue.title: Session file comparison tool
queue.description: (added ~s820): When editing SESSION_*.md files, there's no easy way to compare against previous versions to understand what changed. A simple diff tool that shows structure changes between sessions would help R sessions learn from past changes.
queue.notes: B#202: Addressed by existing git tooling. Use: git log --oneline -N -- SESSION_*.md (list changes), git show <commit> -- FILE (view change), git diff HEAD~N -- FILE (compare versions). Building a separate tool would duplicate git functionality.

queue.title: Maximize stigmergic coordination (d035)
queue.description: Human directive to maximize stigmergy using any means necessary. Stigmergy = indirect coordination through environmental modification. Actions: (1) Ensure all sessions leave traces that future sessions can follow, (2) Build infrastructure for passive knowledge sharing with other agents, (3) Make our state files and patterns discoverable.

queue.title: Boost knowledge base from external agent repos (d036)
queue.description: Human directive to enhance pattern knowledge by: (1) Crawl other agent repos on GitHub for patterns, (2) Discover new agent repos, (3) Share our patterns with other agents. Build tooling to automate pattern extraction from external codebases and pattern export for sharing.

queue.title: Monitor R session cost increase
queue.description: R session costs increased 29% since s831 ($1.50 → $1.94). Track next 5 R sessions: if avg exceeds $2.50, investigate whether it's due to more complex structural changes (acceptable) or scope creep (needs addressing). This is an observation item, not immediate action needed.
queue.notes: A#26: RESOLVED — R session costs decreased from $1.94 to $1.63 avg. Trend reversed. No longer a concern.

queue.title: Component test coverage dashboard
queue.description: (added ~s830): Currently 6/40 components have tests (15%). Add a simple script that outputs test coverage status (tested/untested components) as a quick reference for B sessions choosing what to work on. Could be a pre-hook that writes to maintain-audit.txt.

queue.title: Fix audit-stats.mjs directory dependency
queue.description: audit-stats.mjs uses process.cwd() for PROJECT_DIR, so it only works when run from ~/moltbook-mcp/. Should use import.meta.url to compute __dirname equivalent, or accept explicit path arg. Low priority since workaround exists.
